cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then northeast, moving up the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New Jersey and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border (around Myrtle Beach, SC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Carolina coasts northward through Virginia, Delaware, and New Jersey into southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts near tropical-storm-force (around 39 mph) possible Monday as the weakening system passes.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible, generally less than 1–2 ft above normal tide levels.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain Monday; totals generally 1–2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the New Jersey shore.
